p: Over our study, ANPP averaged 191.5 (± 8.6 SE) g/m 2 (among years: 100.9–316.4 g/m 2) ( Fig 4A), and significantly varied among years and increased by 110.4% over our study ( Table 2, Fig 4A). Grass accounted on average for 79.2% (± 2.2 SE) (among years: 41.0–97.3%) of ANPP ( Fig 4A). Grass production increased by 251%, while forb production decreased by 65% over our study ( Fig 4A). Consequently, grass relative abundance increased by 54% from 61% to 96% ( Table 2, P < 0.000001) of ANPP over our study. Finally, the time (Julian day) at which peak “green” biomass (>88% of ANPP) was observed (late-May–June: Fig 2) varied among years and declined by 23 days (16%) from 1985–2017 ( Table 2).
